New schedules for the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Line take effect on Sunday, October 29. Changes to look for include: On the Port Jervis Line, the 3:19 PM weekday train from Middletown/Town of Wallkill sees its connection time at Secaucus Junction to Penn Station-New York reduced from 16 minute to 8 minutes, resulting in a trip to Penn Station-New York that is 8 minutes faster. On the Pascack Valley Line The 5:58 PM weekday train from Hoboken (5:51 PM from Penn Station-New York) operates 3 minutes later at all stations due to its connection from Penn Station- New York operating 7 minutes later. The connection time at Secaucus Junction is reduced from 12 minutes to 8 minutes. This results in a 4-minute reduction in travel time from Penn Station-New York to Pascack Valley Line stations. See full details at: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/woh_newsched.htm See schedules at: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/linkwest.html

Weekend Busing Between Harriman and Port Jervis Oct. 27-29

Weekend substitute busing will be in effect between Port Jervis and Harriman from late Friday evening, October 27 until Sunday evening, October 29, to accommodate improvements along our right-of-way. Buses will follow train schedules. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/PJ_Busing_1020.pdf Please note: Customers traveling to Hoboken may connect with train service at Harriman. Customers traveling from Salisbury Mills will be bused to Ramsey-Rt. 17, where they can connect with train service to Hoboken. We appreciate your patience during this work to improve our infrastructure.

New schedules for the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Line take effect on Sunday, October 29. Changes to look for include: On the Port Jervis Line, the 3:19 PM weekday train from Middletown/Town of Wallkill sees its connection time at Secaucus Junction to Penn Station-New York reduced from 16 minute to 8 minutes, resulting in a trip to Penn Station-New York that is 8 minutes faster. On the Pascack Valley Line The 5:58 PM weekday train from Hoboken (5:51 PM from Penn Station-New York) operates 3 minutes later at all stations due to its connection from Penn Station- New York operating 7 minutes later. The connection time at Secaucus Junction is reduced from 12 minutes to 8 minutes. This results in a 4-minute reduction in travel time from Penn Station-New York to Pascack Valley Line stations. See full details at: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/woh_newsched.htm See schedules at: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/linkwest.html

New schedules for the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Line take effect on Sunday, October 29. Changes to look for include: On the Port Jervis Line, the 3:19 PM weekday train from Middletown/Town of Wallkill sees its connection time at Secaucus Junction to Penn Station-New York reduced from 16 minute to 8 minutes, resulting in a trip to Penn Station-New York that is 8 minutes faster. On the Pascack Valley Line The 5:58 PM weekday train from Hoboken (5:51 PM from Penn Station-New York) operates 3 minutes later at all stations due to its connection from Penn Station- New York operating 7 minutes later. The connection time at Secaucus Junction is reduced from 12 minutes to 8 minutes. This results in a 4-minute reduction in travel time from Penn Station-New York to Pascack Valley Line stations. Changes to look for include: On the Port Jervis Line, the 3:19 PM weekday train from Middletown/Town of Wallkill sees its connection time at Secaucus Junction to Penn Station-New York reduced from 16 minute to 8 minutes, resulting in a trip to Penn Station-New York that is 8 minutes faster. On the Pascack Valley Line The 5:58 PM weekday train from Hoboken (5:51 PM from Penn Station-New York) operates 3 minutes later at all stations due to its connection from Penn Station- New York operating 7 minutes later. The connection time at Secaucus Junction is reduced from 12 minutes to 8 minutes. This results in a 4-minute reduction in travel time from Penn Station-New York to Pascack Valley Line stations. Weekend Busing Between Harriman and Port Jervis Oct. 27-29

Weekend substitute busing will be in effect between Port Jervis and Harriman from late Friday evening, October 27 until Sunday evening, October 29, to accommodate improvements along our right-of-way. Buses will follow train schedules. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/PJ_Busing_1020.pdf Please note: Customers traveling to Hoboken may connect with train service at Harriman. Customers traveling from Salisbury Mills will be bused to Ramsey-Rt. 17, where they can connect with train service to Hoboken. We appreciate your patience during this work to improve our infrastructure.
Weekday Off-Peak Substitute Busing, Sept. 11 - Through Late Fall

Weekday off-peak substitute busing will be in effect between Port Jervis and Harriman starting Sept. 11, and continuing for several weeks. Inbound (to Hoboken), all trains starting with the 9:26 AM from Port Jervis and ending with the 3:19 PM from Middletown will be bused to Harriman. Outbound (to Port Jervis), all trains starting with the 9:35 AM from Harriman and ending with the 3:48 PM from Harriman will be bused to Port Jervis. Buses will follow the train schedules. Please see http://ow.ly/uSOw30eNabw Thank you for your patience while we complete important rock slope remediation and infrastructure improvements.

UPDATED: New West-of-Hudson Schedules Effective October 29

New schedules for the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Line take effect on Sunday, October 29. Changes to look for include: On the Port Jervis Line, the 3:19 PM weekday train from Middletown/Town of Wallkill sees its connection time at Secaucus Junction to Penn Station-New York reduced from 16 minute to 8 minutes, resulting in a trip to Penn Station-New York that is 8 minutes faster. On the Pascack Valley Line The 5:58 PM weekday train from Hoboken (5:51 PM from Penn Station-New York) operates 3 minutes later at all stations due to its connection from Penn Station- New York operating 7 minutes later. The connection time at Secaucus Junction is reduced from 12 minutes to 8 minutes. This results in a 4-minute reduction in travel time from Penn Station-New York to Pascack Valley Line stations. See full details at: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/woh_newsched.htm See schedules at: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/linkwest.html

New schedules for the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Line take effect on Sunday, October 29. Changes to look for include: On the Port Jervis Line, the 3:19 PM weekday train from Middletown/Town of Wallkill sees its connection time at Secaucus Junction to Penn Station-New York reduced from 16 minute to 8 minutes, resulting in a trip to Penn Station-New York that is 8 minutes faster. On the Pascack Valley Line The 5:58 PM weekday train from Hoboken (5:51 PM from Penn Station-New York) operates 3 minutes later at all stations due to its connection from Penn Station- New York operating 7 minutes later. The connection time at Secaucus Junction is reduced from 12 minutes to 8 minutes. This results in a 4-minute reduction in travel time from Penn Station-New York to Pascack Valley Line stations. See full details at: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/woh_newsched.htm See schedules at: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/linkwest.html

Port Jervis Line, Weekday Off-Peak Substitute Busing, Sept. 11 - Through Late Fall

Weekday off-peak substitute busing will be in effect between Port Jervis and Harriman starting Sept. 11, and continuing for several weeks. Inbound (to Hoboken), all trains starting with the 9:26 AM from Port Jervis and ending with the 3:19 PM from Middletown will be bused to Harriman. Outbound (to Port Jervis), all trains starting with the 9:35 AM from Harriman and ending with the 3:48 PM from Harriman will be bused to Port Jervis. Buses will follow the train schedules. Please see http://ow.ly/uSOw30eNabw. Thank you for your patience while we complete important rock slope remediation and infrastructure improvements.

Planned Work, BKLYN/QNS, Q35 bus, Bridge Maintenance - Marine Parkway-Gil Hodges Memorial Bridge

Planned work: Q35 buses rerouted from the Marine Parkway-Gil Hodges Memorial Bridge 10 PM to 5 AM, Mon to Sat, Oct 23 - Nov 11 Due to bridge maintenance, the Marine Parkway-Gil Hodges Memorial Bridge will be fully closed to traffic. The Q35 will detour non-stop via the Cross Bay Veterans Memorial Bridge. Q35 service will be suspended at all Q35 bus stops on Flatbush Av between Troy Av/Quentin Rd and Floyd Bennett Field. B41 buses provide alternate service along Flatbush Av between Avenue H and Kings Plaza/Avenue U. The Q35 will serve the regular bus stops on Avenue H at Flatbush Av, on Flatbush Av at Kings Hwy, and all bus stops in the Rockaways. Note: MTA Bridges and Tunnels will provide free shuttle service from Aviator Sports/Floyd Bennett Field on Flatbush Av to connect to the Q35 from 10 PM to 11:59 PM.

From 7AM-midnight, Sat/Sun trains to/from stations Farmingdale-Ronkonkoma being diverted via zig-zag route along Babylon & Central Branches. Plan for 60 minutes extra travel time or use south shore branches. Buses will replace overnight trains between Mineola & Hicksville, midnight to 7 AM. See special timetable at https://goo.gl/RHwhrw; or click on the link below for more info.
Oct. 21-22: No Weekend Train Service between Hicksville & Mineola

Today & tomorrow, buses replace all Hunt/Port Jeff trains between Hicksville & Mineola to accommodate installation of new Post Ave. Bridge in Westbury. Train service to/from Huntington reduced to hourly; service between Huntington & Pt. Jeff reduced to 2-hour intervals. Expect 60 mins. added travel time or use Babylon, Hempstead or Montauk branches to avoid busing & delays. See special timetable at https://goo.gl/RHwhrw; or click on link below for more info.

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

See a bus schedule at http://ow.ly/TAis30fpgn5 Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. Thank you for your patience while we complete these important infrastructure improvements.

Ronkonkoma Br. Service Affected This Weekend, Oct. 21-22

Today & tomorrow, expect major changes to Ronkonkoma Branch service. Today & tomorrow, buses replace all trains between Hicksville & Mineola to accommodate installation of the new Post Ave. Bridge in Westbury. Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28. Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Port Jervis Line, Weekday Off-Peak Substitute Busing, Sept. 11 - Through Late Fall

Weekday off-peak substitute busing will be in effect between Port Jervis and Harriman starting Sept. 11, and continuing for several weeks. Inbound (to Hoboken), all trains starting with the 9:26 AM from Port Jervis and ending with the 3:19 PM from Middletown will be bused to Harriman. Outbound (to Port Jervis), all trains starting with the 9:35 AM from Harriman and ending with the 3:48 PM from Harriman will be bused to Port Jervis. Buses will follow the train schedules. Please see http://ow.ly/uSOw30eNabw. Thank you for your patience while we complete important rock slope remediation and infrastructure improvements.

Between Metropolitan Av and Myrtle-Wyckoff Avs (trains run every 20 minutes, Sat and Sun, from 7:30 AM to 9:30 AM). Free shuttle buses operate between Myrtle-Wyckoff Avs and Myrtle Av. Port Jervis Line, Weekday Off-Peak Substitute Busing, Sept. 11 - Through Late Fall

Weekday off-peak substitute busing will be in effect between Port Jervis and Harriman starting Sept. 11, and continuing for several weeks. Inbound (to Hoboken), all trains starting with the 9:26 AM from Port Jervis and ending with the 3:19 PM from Middletown will be bused to Harriman. Outbound (to Port Jervis), all trains starting with the 9:35 AM from Harriman and ending with the 3:48 PM from Harriman will be bused to Port Jervis. Buses will follow the train schedules. Please see http://ow.ly/uSOw30eNabw. Thank you for your patience while we complete important rock slope remediation and infrastructure improvements.

Weekday off-peak substitute busing will be in effect between Port Jervis and Harriman starting Sept. 11, and continuing for several weeks. Inbound (to Hoboken), all trains starting with the 9:26 AM from Port Jervis and ending with the 3:19 PM from Middletown will be bused to Harriman. Outbound (to Port Jervis), all trains starting with the 9:35 AM from Harriman and ending with the 3:48 PM from Harriman will be bused to Port Jervis. Buses will follow the train schedules. Port Jervis Line, Weekday Off-Peak Substitute Busing, Sept. 11 - Through Late Fall

Weekday off-peak substitute busing will be in effect between Port Jervis and Harriman starting Sept. 11, and continuing for several weeks. Inbound (to Hoboken), all trains starting with the 9:26 AM from Port Jervis and ending with the 3:19 PM from Middletown will be bused to Harriman. Outbound (to Port Jervis), all trains starting with the 9:35 AM from Harriman and ending with the 3:48 PM from Harriman will be bused to Port Jervis. Buses will follow the train schedules. Please see http://ow.ly/uSOw30eNabw Thank you for your patience while we complete important rock slope remediation and infrastructure improvements.

On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. LIRR Offers Extra Trains & Package Ticket to Annual Oyster Festival in Oyster Bay

The LIRR is providing extra trains to/from Oyster Bay today for the 34th Annual Oyster Festival. Specially-priced One-Day Getaway package tickets are available at Ticket Windows and Full Service Ticket Machines. Take your LIRR ticket with you when exiting the train; it will be collected at Oyster Bay Station. Returning from the festival, LIRR tickets will be collected at the Oyster Bay Station platform, prior to boarding the train. For more info and train schedule see https://goo.gl/RQ9aQh.

Port Jervis Line, Weekday Off-Peak Substitute Busing, Sept. 11 - Through Late Fall

Weekday off-peak substitute busing will be in effect between Port Jervis and Harriman starting Sept. 11, and continuing for several weeks. Inbound (to Hoboken), all trains starting with the 9:26 AM from Port Jervis and ending with the 3:19 PM from Middletown will be bused to Harriman. Outbound (to Port Jervis), all trains starting with the 9:35 AM from Harriman and ending with the 3:48 PM from Harriman will be bused to Port Jervis. Buses will follow the train schedules. Please see http://ow.ly/uSOw30eNabw Thank you for your patience while we complete important rock slope remediation and infrastructure improvements.
Lynbrook Platform A Elevator Out of Service

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing thru Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance until Saturday, October 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing thru Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance until Saturday, October 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing thru Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance until Saturday, October 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

New Timetables, in effect as of October 8, 2017

New timetables are now in effect, as of Sunday, October 8. Featured adjustments restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line, four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:15 AM, 5:40 AM, 6:37 AM and 8:12 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier from Croton-Harmon through Hastings-on-Hudson. (Please note these amended times reflecting earlier departures from a prior notice). In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules, with the 6:59 PM departing the Terminal at 6:55 PM, 4 minutes earlier, and the 7:21 PM stopping 4 minutes earlier at stations from Croton-Harmon through Poughkeepsie. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. New Timetables, in effective as of October 8, 2017

New timetables are now in effective, as of Sunday, October 8. Featured adjustments restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line, four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:15 AM, 5:40 AM, 6:37 AM and 8:12 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier from Croton-Harmon through Hastings-on-Hudson. (Please note these amended times reflecting earlier departures from a prior notice). In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules, with the 6:59 PM departing the Terminal at 6:55 PM, 4 minutes earlier, and the 7:21 PM stopping 4 minutes earlier at stations from Croton-Harmon through Poughkeepsie. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. Eight midday trains towards White Plains and Southeast will depart Grand Central 3 minutes earlier. On the New Haven Line Sixteen New Haven-bound trains operating between 7:30 AM and 3:05 PM have their schedules adjusted by 1-3 minutes. See full details for all lines at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/oct8_seatnotice.html New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, at www.mta.info/mnr and via our Metro-North Train Time app for iPhone or Android

Updated Message Regarding New Timetables, Effective October 8, 2017

***The following information is an update from a prior notice regarding our new timetables effective on Sunday, October 8th.*** New timetables, effective Sunday, October 8, feature adjustments that restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line, four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:15 AM, 5:40 AM, 6:37 AM and 8:12 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier from Croton-Harmon through Hastings-on-Hudson. (Please note these amended times reflecting earlier departures from a prior notice). In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules, with the 6:59 PM departing the Terminal at 6:55 PM, 4 minutes earlier, and the 7:21 PM stopping 4 minutes earlier at stations from Croton-Harmon through Poughkeepsie. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. Eight midday trains towards White Plains and Southeast will depart Grand Central 3 minutes earlier. On the New Haven Line Sixteen New Haven-bound trains operating between 7:30 AM and 3:05 PM have their schedules adjusted by 1-3 minutes. See full details for all lines at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/oct8_seatnotice.html New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, at www.mta.info/mnr and via our Metro-North Train Time app for iPhone or Android

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing thru Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance until Saturday, Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Updated Message Regarding New Timetables, Effective October 8, 2017

***The following information is an update from a prior notice regarding our new timetables effective on Sunday, October 8th.*** New timetables, effective Sunday, October 8, feature adjustments that restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line, four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:15 AM, 5:40 AM, 6:37 AM and 8:12 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier from Croton-Harmon through Hastings-on-Hudson. (Please note these amended times reflecting earlier departures from a prior notice). In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules, with the 6:59 PM departing the Terminal at 6:55 PM, 4 minutes earlier, and the 7:21 PM stopping 4 minutes earlier at stations from Croton-Harmon through Poughkeepsie. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. Eight midday trains towards White Plains and Southeast will depart Grand Central 3 minutes earlier. On the New Haven Line Sixteen New Haven-bound trains operating between 7:30 AM and 3:05 PM have their schedules adjusted by 1-3 minutes. See full details for all lines at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/oct8_seatnotice.html New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, at www.mta.info/mnr and via our Metro-North Train Time app for iPhone or Android View: http://n.v12.net/m?712CB

Updated Message Regarding New Timetables, Effective October 8, 2017

***The following information is an update from a prior notice regarding our new timetables effective on Sunday, October 8th.*** New timetables, effective Sunday, October 8, feature adjustments that restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line, four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:15 AM, 5:40 AM, 6:37 AM and 8:12 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier from Croton-Harmon through Hastings-on-Hudson. (Please note these amended times reflecting earlier departures from a prior notice). In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules, with the 6:59 PM departing the Terminal at 6:55 PM, 4 minutes earlier, and the 7:21 PM stopping 4 minutes earlier at stations from Croton-Harmon through Poughkeepsie. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. Eight midday trains towards White Plains and Southeast will depart Grand Central 3 minutes earlier. On the New Haven Line Sixteen New Haven-bound trains operating between 7:30 AM and 3:05 PM have their schedules adjusted by 1-3 minutes. See full details for all lines at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/oct8_seatnotice.html New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, at www.mta.info/mnr and via our Metro-North Train Time app for iPhone or Android

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing thru Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance until Saturday, Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Updated Message Regarding New Timetables, Effective October 8, 2017

***The following information is an update from a prior notice regarding our new timetables effective on Sunday, October 8th.*** New timetables, effective Sunday, October 8, feature adjustments that restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line, four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:15 AM, 5:40 AM, 6:37 AM and 8:12 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier from Croton-Harmon through Hastings-on-Hudson. (Please note these amended times reflecting earlier departures from a prior notice). In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules, with the 6:59 PM departing the Terminal at 6:55 PM, 4 minutes earlier, and the 7:21 PM stopping 4 minutes earlier at stations from Croton-Harmon through Poughkeepsie. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. Eight midday trains towards White Plains and Southeast will depart Grand Central 3 minutes earlier. On the New Haven Line Sixteen New Haven-bound trains operating between 7:30 AM and 3:05 PM have their schedules adjusted by 1-3 minutes. See full details for all lines at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/oct8_seatnotice.html New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, at www.mta.info/mnr and via our Metro-North Train Time app for iPhone or Android

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing thru Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance until Saturday, Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.
UPDATED: Updated Message Regarding New Timetables, Effective October 8, 2017

***The following information is an update from a prior notice regarding our new timetables effective on Sunday, October 8th.*** New timetables, effective Sunday, October 8, feature adjustments that restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line, four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:15 AM, 5:40 AM, 6:37 AM and 8:12 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier from Croton-Harmon through Hastings-on-Hudson. (Please note these amended times reflecting earlier departures from a prior notice). In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules, with the 6:59 PM departing the Terminal at 6:55 PM, 4 minutes earlier, and the 7:21 PM stopping 4 minutes earlier at stations from Croton-Harmon through Poughkeepsie. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. Eight midday trains towards White Plains and Southeast will depart Grand Central 3 minutes earlier. On the New Haven Line Sixteen New Haven-bound trains operating between 7:30 AM and 3:05 PM have their schedules adjusted by 1-3 minutes. See full details for all lines at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/oct8_seatnotice.html New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, at www.mta.info/mnr and via our Metro-North Train Time app for iPhone or Android

Updated Message Regarding New Timetables, Effective October 8th, 2017

***The following information is an update from a prior notice regarding our new timetables effective on Sunday, October 8th.*** New timetables, effective Sunday, October 8, feature adjustments that restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line, four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:15 AM, 5:40 AM, 6:37 AM and 8:12 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier from Croton-Harmon through Hastings-on-Hudson. (Please note these amended times reflecting earlier departures from a prior notice). In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules, with the 6:59 PM departing the Terminal at 6:55 PM, 4 minutes earlier, and the 7:21 PM stopping 4 minutes earlier at stations from Croton-Harmon through Poughkeepsie. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. Eight midday trains towards White Plains and Southeast will depart Grand Central 3 minutes earlier. On the New Haven Line Sixteen New Haven-bound trains operating between 7:30 AM and 3:05 PM have their schedules adjusted by 1-3 minutes. See full details for all lines at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/oct8_seatnotice.html New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, at www.mta.info/mnr and via our Metro-North Train Time app for iPhone or Android

Updated Message Regarding New Timetables, Effective October 8th, 2017

***The following information is an update from a prior notice regarding our new timetables effective on Sunday, October 8th.*** New timetables, effective Sunday, October 8, feature adjustments that restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line, four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:15 AM, 5:40 AM, 6:37 AM and 8:12 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier from Croton-Harmon through Hastings-on-Hudson. (Please note these amended times reflecting earlier departures from a prior notice). In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules, with the 6:59 PM departing the Terminal at 6:55 PM, 4 minutes earlier, and the 7:21 PM stopping 4 minutes earlier at stations from Croton-Harmon through Poughkeepsie. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. Eight midday trains towards White Plains and Southeast will depart Grand Central 3 minutes earlier. On the New Haven Line Sixteen New Haven-bound trains operating between 7:30 AM and 3:05 PM have their schedules adjusted by 1-3 minutes. See full details for all lines at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/oct8_seatnotice.html New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, at www.mta.info/mnr and via our Metro-North Train Time app for iPhone or Android

UPDATED: Updated Message Regarding New Timetables, Effective October 8, 2017

***The following information is an update from a prior notice regarding our new timetables effective on Sunday, October 8th.*** New timetables, effective Sunday, October 8, feature adjustments that restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line, four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:15 AM, 5:40 AM, 6:37 AM and 8:12 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier from Croton-Harmon through Hastings-on-Hudson. (Please note these amended times reflecting earlier departures from a prior notice). In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules, with the 6:59 PM departing the Terminal at 6:55 PM, 4 minutes earlier, and the 7:21 PM stopping 4 minutes earlier at stations from Croton-Harmon through Poughkeepsie. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. Eight midday trains towards White Plains and Southeast will depart Grand Central 3 minutes earlier. On the New Haven Line Sixteen New Haven-bound trains operating between 7:30 AM and 3:05 PM have their schedules adjusted by 1-3 minutes. See full details for all lines at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/oct8_seatnotice.html New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, at www.mta.info/mnr and via our Metro-North Train Time app for iPhone or Android

Updated Message Regarding New Timetables, Effective October 8, 2017

***The following information is an update from a prior notice regarding our new timetables effective on Sunday, October 8t.*** New timetables, effective Sunday, October 8, feature adjustments that restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line, four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:15 AM, 5:40 AM, 6:37 AM and 8:12 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier from Croton-Harmon through Hastings-on-Hudson. (Please note these amended times reflecting earlier departures from a prior notice). In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules, with the 6:59 PM departing the Terminal at 6:55 PM, 4 minutes earlier, and the 7:21 PM stopping 4 minutes earlier at stations from Croton-Harmon through Poughkeepsie. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. Eight midday trains towards White Plains and Southeast will depart Grand Central 3 minutes earlier. On the New Haven Line Sixteen New Haven-bound trains operating between 7:30 AM and 3:05 PM have their schedules adjusted by 1-3 minutes. See full details for all lines at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/oct8_seatnotice.html New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, at www.mta.info/mnr and via our Metro-North Train Time app for iPhone or Android

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing thru Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance until Saturday, Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

New timetables, effective Sunday, October 8, feature adjustments that restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line Four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:20 AM, 5:45 AM, 6:42 AM and 8:17 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier through Hastings-on-Hudson. In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. On the New Haven Line Sixteen New Haven-bound trains operating between 7:30 AM and 3:05 PM have their schedules adjusted by 1-3 minutes. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/oct8_seatnotice.html New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, at www.mta.info/mnr and via our Metro-North Train Time app for iPhone or Android

Buses Replace Two Trains btwn Riverhead & Greenport Today

Today, buses will replace two off-peak midday trains between Riverhead & Greenport due to grade crossing improvement work at Love Lane in Mattituck. For revised train/bus departure times, pick up the special Greenport Service timetable dated October 4 or click on attached link.

New timetables, effective Sunday, October 8, feature adjustments that restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line Four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:20 AM, 5:45 AM, 6:42 AM and 8:17 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier through Hastings-on-Hudson. In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. On the New Haven Line Sixteen New Haven-bound trains operating between 7:30 AM and 3:05 PM have their schedules adjusted by 1-3 minutes. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/oct8_seatnotice.html New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, at www.mta.info/mnr and via our Metro-North Train Time app for iPhone or Android

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing thru Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance until Saturday, Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

New timetables, effective Sunday, October 8, feature adjustments that restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line Four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:20 AM, 5:45 AM, 6:42 AM and 8:17 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier through Hastings-on-Hudson. In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. On the New Haven Line Sixteen New Haven-bound trains operating between 7:30 AM and 3:05 PM have their schedules adjusted by 1-3 minutes. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/oct8_seatnotice.html New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, at www.mta.info/mnr and via our Metro-North Train Time app for iPhone or Android

New timetables, effective Sunday, October 8, feature adjustments that restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line Four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:20 AM, 5:45 AM, 6:42 AM and 8:17 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier through Hastings-on-Hudson. In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. On the New Haven Line Sixteen New Haven-bound trains operating between 7:30 AM and 3:05 PM have their schedules adjusted by 1-3 minutes. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/oct8_seatnotice.html New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, at www.mta.info/mnr and via our Metro-North Train Time app for iPhone or Android

New timetables, effective Sunday, October 8, feature adjustments that restore service while allowing critical infrastructure work that improves the safety and reliability of your commute to continue. Changes to look for include: On the Hudson Line Four AM peak trains departing Croton-Harmon (5:20 AM, 5:45 AM, 6:42 AM and 8:17 AM) will operate 1 minute earlier through Hastings-on-Hudson. In the PM peak, the 6:59 PM and 7:21 PM trains from Grand Central revert to their normal schedules. On the Harlem Line AM and PM peak service returns to pre-June 4 schedules thanks to the completion of a comprehensive track improvement program between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood. On the New Haven Line Sixteen New Haven-bound trains operating between 7:30 AM and 3:05 PM have their schedules adjusted by 1-3 minutes. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/oct8_seatnotice.html New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, at www.mta.info/mnr and via our Metro-North Train Time app for iPhone or Android

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance until Saturday, Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance until Saturday, Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.
